holidays.name: World Compliment Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to brightening someone's mood by giving sincere compliments. The goal is to spread kindness and positivity through genuine praise.
holidays.origin: Believed to have started in the early 2000s via social campaigns encouraging positive social interactions.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that giving compliments can boost both the giver's and receiver's happiness!

holidays.name: National Peanut Butter Lover’s Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to celebrate the creamy, crunchy, and irresistible spread known as peanut butter.
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday started in the US to recognize peanut butter’s popularity and versatility.
holidays.funFact: George Washington Carver, the peanut farming innovator, helped popularize peanut products including peanut butter!

holidays.name: Self Injury Awareness Day
holidays.description: An important awareness day intended to educate and reduce stigma around self-harm behaviors, offering support and understanding to those affected.
holidays.origin: Established by advocacy groups in the early 2000s to bring attention and compassion to mental health struggles.
holidays.funFact: Raising awareness has helped promote better mental health resources worldwide.

holidays.name: Horse Protection Day
holidays.description: This day highlights the importance of protecting horse populations and promoting animal welfare.
holidays.origin: Started by equestrian groups to advocate humane treatment of horses and raise awareness of equine issues.
holidays.funFact: Horses have been companions to humans for over 5,000 years!
